pageContext.claim: “When a senator, who I like, and there are a number of them or when a congressperson who I like comes into the White House Oval Office, they want to see me, ‘Sir, we'd really like you to stop treating these countries so bad.’ I said, ‘We have a tremendous massive deficit. We're losing a lot of money. … They're charging us a 50 percent tariff. We're charging them a 20 percent tariff. Do you think that's OK?’”
pageContext.analysis: Countries do not lose money on trade. A trade deficit simply means that people in one country are buying more goods from another country than vice-versa. Tariff rates vary widely by product and in some cases the U.S. imposes higher tariffs than other countries.
